etymology.description: Depicts a cauldron or cooking vessel
etymology.interpretation: 䰜(䰜) (lì, "cauldron") is an ancient form of 鬲(鬲) (lì, "cauldron"), both depict a cooking vessel, diverged over time.

examples.chinese: 他在村里发现了一口古老的䰜(他在村裡發現了一口古老的䰜)，旁人传说它曾用于祭祀(旁人傳說它曾用於祭祀)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài cūn lǐ fāxiàn le yì kǒu gǔlǎo de lì, pángrén chuánshuō tā céng yòng yú jìsì.
examples.english: He discovered an ancient cauldron in the village, and people say it was once used for sacrificial rituals.

examples.chinese: 文人叹息古时铸就精美䰜(文人嘆息古時鑄就精美䰜)，见证历史风云(見證歷史風雲)。
examples.pinyin: Wénrén tànxī gǔshí zhùjiù jīngměi de lì, jiànzhèng lìshǐ fēngyún.
examples.english: Scholars lament that the exquisitely cast ancient cauldron bears witness to a turbulent history.
